perturbation.original_text: Section 12.07. Waiver of Jury Trial. THE PARTIES HERETO HEREBY IRREVOCABLY WAIVE ------ -- ---- ----- ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY OR THEREBY.
perturbation.explanation: This clause has been completely omitted, removing the customer's right to a jury trial. In many jurisdictions, including in contract disputes, the right to a jury trial is protected, and its removal could create legal challenges under consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution; Various state laws protecting the right to a jury trial in civil cases.

perturbation.original_text: Section 11.03. Limitation on Types of Damages. Except for breach of Article VIII and for Article XII, in no event shall either Party be liable to the other Party for any indirect, incidental and/or consequential damages resulting from a breach of this agreement, including without limitation lost business, lost savings, and lost profits even if the breaching Party has been advised of the possibility of the occurrence of such damages. In no event shall either Party be liable for any special or punitive damages arising from breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 11.03. Limitation on Types of Damages. In no event shall either Party be liable to the other Party for any indirect, incidental and/or consequential damages resulting from a breach of this agreement, including without limitation lost business, lost savings, and lost profits even if the breaching Party has been advised of the possibility of the occurrence of such damages.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'Except for breach of Article VIII and for Article XII' means that there is no recourse for either party regarding information exchanges or miscellaneous items. This creates a legal contradiction because in some cases, especially relating to confidentiality (Article VIII) there is a mandatory claim for damages.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction but generally affects the enforceability of contract terms related to confidentiality and other protected rights.

perturbation.original_text: Section 8.02. Confidential Information. Entrust and Nortel shall hold in trust ------------------------ and maintain confidential all Confidential Information relating to the other Party. "Confidential Information" shall mean all information disclosed by either ------------------------ Party to the other in connection with this Agreement whether orally, visually, in writing or in any other tangible form, and includes, but is not limited to, technical, scientific, economic and business data, business plans, and the like, but shall not include (i) information which becomes generally available other than by release in violation of the provisions of this Section 8.01, (ii) information which becomes available on a non-confidential basis to a Party from a source other than the other Party, provided the Party in question reasonably believes that such source is not or was not bound to hold such information confidential, (iii) information acquired or developed independently by a Party without violating this Section 8.02 or any other confidentiality agreement with the other Party and (iv) information that any Party reasonably believes it is required to disclose by law, provided that it first notifies the other Party of such requirement and allows such Party a reasonable opportunity to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy to prevent such disclosure. Without prejudice to the rights and remedies of either Party, a Party disclosing any Confidential Information to the other Party in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement shall be entitled to equitable relief by way of an injunction if the other Party breaches or threatens to breach any provision of this Section 8.02.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 8.02. Confidential Information. Entrust and Nortel shall hold in trust ------------------------ and maintain confidential all Confidential Information relating to the other Party. "Confidential Information" shall mean all information disclosed by either ------------------------ Party to the other in connection with this Agreement whether orally, visually, in writing or in any other tangible form, and includes, but is not limited to, technical, scientific, economic and business data, business plans, and the like, but shall not include (i) information which becomes generally available other than by release in violation of the provisions of this Section 8.01, (ii) information which becomes available on a non-confidential basis to a Party from a source other than the other Party, provided the Party in question reasonably believes that such source is not or was not bound to hold such information confidential, (iii) information acquired or developed independently by a Party without violating this Section 8.02 or any other confidentiality agreement with the other Party and (iv) information that any Party reasonably believes it is required to disclose by law.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of the final sentence, 'Without prejudice to the rights and remedies of either Party, a Party disclosing any Confidential Information to the other Party in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement shall be entitled to equitable relief by way of an injunction if the other Party breaches or threatens to breach any provision of this Section 8.02.', removes the right to seek an injunction for breaches of confidentiality. This weakens the protection of confidential information and could contradict legal standards related to trade secret protection, potentially contravening laws concerning intellectual property protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction; may affect trade secret laws and enforcement of confidentiality agreements.
